citation.article-title: Rhodococcus jostii sp. nov., isolated from a medieval grave.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodococcus jostii sp. nov.
Rhodococcus jostii (jos´ti.i. N.L. adj. jostii of Jošt, in honour of Margrave Jošt Lucemburský, one of the most important Czech rulers, from whose skeletal remains strain CCM 4760T was isolated)
Cells are aerobic, non-motile and Gram-positive.
The substrate mycelium, which is often fragmented into rods or coccoid elements, penetrates into agar media.
The cells are irregular rods, which form filaments (0⋄4–0⋄6 x 8–12 μm) in the early growth phase and form mostly cocci or short rods (0⋄2–0⋄5 x 1⋄7–3 μm) during the exponential growth phase.
The colonies are light pink, opaque and convex with slightly irregular edges on PY agar.
Grows optimally at 15–30 °C, but does not grow at 37 °C.
Catalase- and β-galactosidase- positive and urease-, DNase- and lecithinase-negative.
Tyrosine is hydrolysed.
Aesculin, gelatin, Tween 80, casein and starch are not hydrolysed.
Maltose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, sodium succinate, sodium fumarate, m-hydroxybutyrate, p-hydroxybenzoate and quinate are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources.
D-Galactose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, inositol, sorbitol, sucrose, glycerol, trehalose, sodium malate, sodium citrate, sodium lactate, proline, L-serine and L-leucine are not utilized.
Acid is produced from glucose, mannitol, fructose, xylose and lactose.
The cell wall contains mess-diaminopimelic acid, arabinose and galactose (wall chemotype IV).
The predominant menaquinone is MK-8(H2).
The major fatty acid is C16:0, and 10-methyl-branched fatty acids are present.
Mycolic acids are present.
The G+C content of the DNA is 67⋄4 mol %.
Isolated from a femur in the remains in the grave of Jošt Lucemburský .
The type strain is strain IFO 16295T (= CCM 4760T).
